cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles NW of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest, then turning north-northwest and riding up the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Ocean Reef FL to Sebastian Inlet FL (far south of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning across the Central, Southeastern and Northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida to Maine is in the projected impact swath
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely breezy conditions (25–35 mph gusts)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Delaware River; only minor tidal rises possible
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 1–3 inches of rain late Tuesday into early Wednesday with isolated heavier downpours
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief reduced visibility in squalls, elevated river levels, and possible logistical delays due to regional roadway flooding
